[[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]][[feedback:prt4]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

  • Data Source: The origin or specific location from where statistical facts are obtained.
  • Raw Data: Data recorded in its original form as collected (ungrouped), without any organization or processing.
  • Tertiary Sources: These are sources that facilitate the identification and location of primary and secondary sources. Examples include bibliographies, indexes, and encyclopedias.
  • Primary Sources: Original materials or first-hand information collected directly by the researcher for a specific purpose (e.g., surveys, interviews).
